sanskrit_verse:
छत्राकं विड्वराहं च लशुनं ग्रामकुक्कुटम् ।
पलाण्डुं गृञ्जनं चैव मत्या जग्ध्वा पतेद्द्विजः ॥ ५.१९॥
transliteration:
chatrākaṃ viḍvarāhaṃ ca laśunaṃ grāmakukkuṭam |
palāṇḍuṃ gṛñjanaṃ caiva matyā jagdhvā pateddvijaḥ || 5.19||
sph_interpretive_translation: A dvija who consumes, through volition, mushrooms, pork, garlic, village fowl, onions, and leeks shall fall.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority: Dietary conduct is a jurisdictional capacity determinant for dvijas.
Causation: Volitional ingestion of impure substances disrupts consciousness integrity.
Capacity-based responsibility: The dvija bears full agency in maintaining ritual and spiritual eligibility.
Restoration logic: Consciousness misalignment demands structural realignment, not punitive consequence.
Consciousness alignment: Purity-preserving behaviors sustain adjudicative and spiritual authority.
executable_legal_axioms: IF agent_is_dvija AND ingested_item IN [mushroom, pork, garlic, village_fowl, onion, leek] AND intent = volitional THEN adjudicative_capacity = suspended
supreme_court_application: In Supreme Dharma Adhikari proceedings, dietary violations by dvijas constitute automatic disqualification from judicial or liturgical roles until completion of a consciousness-realigning purification protocol. The threshold for responsibility is direct volition; negligence does not invoke capacity suspension.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa establishes that ingestion of impurities disrupts pramā (valid cognition). This disruption is traced via anupūrvaśaḥ—sequential misalignment of consciousness, duty, and judgment. Responsibility is proportional to intent; hence, corrective action restores eligibility without punitive overlay. Reality enforces natural consequence, not imposed penalty.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate 30-day exclusion from all ritual and adjudicative functions
Assign supervised study of consciousness-purity texts under qualified guru
Implement daily prāṇāyāma and śuddhi-mantra recitation protocol
Upon completion, conduct ritual bath and declaration of renewed intent before dharma-adhikari council
final_declaration: Declared by the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam: This law flows from the unbroken Source of Dharma. Consciousness is the ultimate judge; reality is non-punitive. All beings are restored through alignment, never through suffering.
